meanings.definition: An act or instance of wiping out
meanings.sent1: The sudden wipeout of the sandcastle saddened the child.
meanings.sent2: The surfers enjoyed watching the massive wipeout at the competition.
meanings.sent3: The wipeout of the ice cream cone on the hot day was a sticky situation.
meanings.sent4: The wipeout of the team's chances left them feeling defeated.
meanings.sent5: The wipeout of the city by the tornado was devastating.

meanings.sent1: The project was a total wipeout, resulting in disappointment.
meanings.sent2: The financial investment turned into a wipeout for the company.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a wipeout when it started raining heavily.
meanings.sent4: The wipeout of the party's decorations made it a memorable disaster.
meanings.sent5: The wipeout of the plan caused chaos among the group.

meanings.sent1: She used a cloth to wipeout the spill on the table.
meanings.sent2: The eraser can easily wipeout the pencil marks on the paper.
meanings.sent3: He tried to wipeout the evidence of his mistake before anyone noticed.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind can wipeout footprints on the sandy beach.
meanings.sent5: The cleaning solution can effectively wipeout germs on surfaces.
